scripts.lint: npm run prettier && npm run eslint && npm run tsc

scriptsComments.build: build this nextJS app to be started on a production server
scriptsComments.dev: run this nextJS in development mode
scriptsComments.eslint: run linting rules as defined in eslintrc.js
scriptsComments.fetch-swapi-data: run the script that fetches Star Wars data from the SWAPI API
scriptsComments.prettier: fix all prettier formatting warnings in the project
scriptsComments.start: start the nextJS app on a production server
scriptsComments.test: run unit tests which I don't have any yet

dependenciesComments.@headlessui/react: unstyled components from the makers of tailwind css
dependenciesComments.@vaadin/vaadin-date-picker: a date picker web component that's used for filtering
dependenciesComments.gray-matter: used for reading markdown file front matter
dependenciesComments.react-toastify: toastrs used to display (error) messages to the user

devDependenciesComments.@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin: a plugin with Typescript-specific ESLint rules
devDependenciesComments.@typescript-eslint/parser: The parser that will allow ESLint to lint Typescript code
devDependenciesComments.eslint-config-prettier: disable the ESLint rules that interfere with prettier
devDependenciesComments.eslint-plugin-prettier: turns prettier rules into eslint rules (https://khalilstemmler.com/blogs/tooling/prettier/).  run prettier as an eslint rule.  See https://github.com/prettier/eslint-plugin-prettier#recommended-configuration for reference
devDependenciesComments.eslint-plugin-react: React specific linting rules for eslint
devDependenciesComments.node-fetch: fetch() for a node-js script that I'm using for pre-fetching the SWAPI data before this project is built
devDependenciesComments.ts-node: allow nodejs to run typescript files?  Brought in when defining prisma seed functions with typescript files.  https://www.prisma.io/docs/guides/database/seed-database
